instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
With battery connected the charger light will after 30 seconds or so turn off. MacBook will still stay on and run but battery no longer charging.
I then have to remove the charger from the mains and count to 20/30 seconds before the charger will work again.
If I plug the charger back in the same thing will happen.
With battery connected PPBUS is 11.33v (which is wrong) should be 12.56
If I disconnect battery PPBUS back to normal.
The board must of has some work done on it in the past as it's been run through an ultrasonic ( I can tell)
Can't see any signs of corrosion although the dc-in port was burnt out when client dropped it off.

Have tried SMC/PRAM resets. Have tried a new battery. Have not tried an SMC reflow yet

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
"With battery connected PPBUS is 11.33v (which is wrong) should be 12.56"
Do NOT make wrong assumptions so easy.
PPBUS_G3H voltage depends by battery charge level, if is connected!

Did you try known good DCIN board?
I'm not sure if you said it was burnt.
Your english is not easy to understand; try a better translation, please.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
HI, Yes tried a new DC-IN Board and a new battery still same issue.
Sorry about the good English

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: Also tried multiple chargers

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: Have tried replacing U7100, Reflowed SMC, Replaced D7010 and replaced Q7130 but problem still persists.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
Don't go so fast, or you risk to fry the board.
Put some logic on your job.

First, check continuity between U7000 and central pin of Magsafe connector.
If good, post U7000 voltages.

Just in case, check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
Can you be more specific regarding continuity test? Which pin on U7000 and which central pin on Magsafe please?
Thanks

[ATTACH type="full" alt="1629405196746.png"]60111[/ATTACH]

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
The schematic is VERY CLEAR.
Which pin do you think have in common DCIN board, U7000 and J7000???
Apart of ground, of course...

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: Adapter Sense pin6 on J7000 and pin5 on U7000 ??

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
How this can assure good contact with central pin of Magsafe connector???
DCIN board has 1-2 small resistors/coils in series in that line.
I hope you don't need DCIN schematic to find them.

As you already tried (supposed) good DCIN board, your problem should be on MLB.
However, to avoid J6700 failure, I still recommend to check directly between U7000 and Magsafe connector (on DCIN board).

"If good, post U7000 voltages."
Don't forget...

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
What is J6700 ??? I have checked from the middle pin on MagSafe to Pin 5 of U7000 and there is no problem with continuity.
Do you want U7000 voltages without battery plugged in?
Thanks

Note " I hope you don't need DCIN schematic to find them. " lol that's really funny hahahaha :)

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
Magsafe light must come amber without battery.
Be sure to use original 60-85W Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
U7000 Readings with MagSafe plugged in amber light (no battery)

Pin 1 - SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 3.395v
Pin 2 - Ground = 0v
Pin 3 - Unconnected = 0v
Pin 4 - Sys_Onewire = 3.373v
Pin 5 - Adapter_Sense = 3.373v

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
Any reason to check it with amber lighr present???
We try to find why Magsafe light goes off; don't you want to check voltage then?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: MagSafe light will only go off if battery connected and magsafe plugged in. Which voltage do you want me to check?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: Do you want me to measure voltages at U7000 with battery and magsafe connected (when magsafe light goes out)?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
U7000 voltages present interes, if Magsafe light stays off.
If you get the light, do you think that U7000 can have bad voltages?
You didn't mention the problem ONLY appears with battery connected.

"check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus"
Still pending...

Did you try known good battery?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
With battery ONLY I get the following:-

SCL = 3.383v   .496
SDA = 3.383v  .494

Yes have tried with different known good batteries.

If I plug the charger in the light goes out one second before I get USB activity and then the voltages are not stable on SCL and SDA.

SCL & SDA fluctuate from 2.81 to 3.38v

To answer your question " If you get the light, do you think that U7000 can have bad voltages? " I think NO and that means U7000 Good?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
Possibly, that's the reason I asked about SCL/SDA and known good battery.
However, is better to get U7000 voltages when the problem appears.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: When the problem happens all voltages on U7000 are ZERO

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: Then post U7001 voltages at same time.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
U7100 Voltages
[B]MagSafe Only[/B]
Pin 1 - SMC_BC_ACOK = 3.395
Pin 2 - SMC_BC_ACOK = 3.150
Pin 3 - GND = 0
Pin 4 - SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 3.395
Pin 5 - PP3v42_G3H = 3.395
[B]Battery Only[/B]
Pin 1 - SMC_BC_ACOK = 0
Pin 2 - SMC_BC_ACOK = 0
Pin 3 - GND = 0
Pin 4 - SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 0
Pin 5 - PP3v42_G3H = 3.391
[B]Battery + Charger[/B]
Pin 1 - SMC_BC_ACOK = 0
Pin 2 - SMC_BC_ACOK = 0
Pin 3 - GND = 0
Pin 4 - SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 0
Pin 5 - PP3v42_G3H = 3.391

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
Put some logic on your job and avoid wasting time!
Any reason to measure U7001 with battery alone?
Did you ever see a Magsafe light on, in such case?

You lose SMC_BC_ACOK, good enough to lose the Magsafe light too.
Post basic U7100 voltages in that case; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 19, 20, 27.
Be sure no short between R7120/50.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message: Should I have the battery and magsafe pugged in when measuring the voltages on U7100 ?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
You've said to get the problem ONLY when both charger and battery are connected.
Now make a guess, please...

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
[B]U7100 with charger and battery connected[/B]
pin 1 =  .019
pin 2 = .078
pin 3 = .019
pin 9 = 0
pin 12 = 3.390
pin 13 = 3.360
pin 15 = .060
pin 19 = 0
pin 20 = 0
pin 27 = 10.55

How do I check for a short between R7120 and R7150 please?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
"pin 2 = .078"
Missing DCIN voltage.
Post Q7010 voltages.

Possibly original charger detects leakage, or overload.
Post PPBUS_G3H voltage only with charger.
Did you test with fake charger, or lab PSU?

Check resistance over C7120/50.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H charger only = 12.57
With lab PSU only and NO battery I get green then amber light but I can't get the board to power on (have tried powering on using the pads and also with keyboard)
It will, however, power on with lab PSU + Battery and the light does stay on the magsafe (amber)

I don't know how to give you the voltage readings for Q7010 as my board view shows a different orientation of the chip from my actual logic board.

c7120 = 28.49 mega ohms
c7150 = 3.8 ohms

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
"c7120 = 28.49 mega ohms"
Check R7121/22 and their traces.
Fix that; should be good enough to solve the problem.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" A1502 820-4924-a
threads.message:
R7121 and 22 were open circuit. Replaced both and problem solved.
You are an absolute genius! I don't know how you do it but I will read through our discussion and try and understand why you asked me to do the things you asked me to do.

Thank you very much!
